content.description: This is the super aesthetic right arete on Anvil Boulder. There is not much more to it than that.
Stand start the right side of the Anvil Boulder, and make good moves up the steep slab to a crux dyno. The sit adds a move or two but doesn't change the grade.
Sit start and power up the sheer arete/face.
content.location: Walk down the narrow alley to the right of the Anvil Boulder, and it is the far left arete.

content.description: Climb the steep face, and be careful topping out.
content.location: This is on the face to the right of the arete on the right of Hammer Time.

content.description: Use the jugs and footholds on the choppy arete to deadpoint to a sloped jug. Use the crack system above to top out into the pine tree.
content.location: It is on the block left of the Anvil Boulder.

content.description: Stand starting on the block that sits just under and right of the slabby face (not the Anvil Boulder, the one to the right). Pull onto the face, work your way up good feet into a crack, and top out.
content.protection: A couple of pads with a spotter if you’re not solid at the V1 grade.

content.description: Start with your right hand low on the main arete, your left hand on the lower block, and a right heel hook. Top out at the highest point of the arete by slapping up and using heel hooks as well as good footholds on the lower block.
content.protection: Two pads and a spotter or two.
content.location: This is the small sharp arete on the balanced block left of the Anvil Boulder.

climbs.name: Between an Anvil and a Hard Place

content.description:
Start in the narrow alley between the Anvil Boulder and the boulder beside it, and establish your feet stemming between the two boulders on the side closest to Warm-Up Arete. Stem up to the top, and grab the top of the Anvil Boulder to transition to the face, and top out. A topout on the boulder on the other side would add some moves and be a little harder, but the topout would need some cleaning.

 This is a great way to learn stemming or to warm up a bit.
content.protection: Depending on how flexible your pad is, you might be able to get it in there. However, the stemming is very secure, so this is easily done without a pad.

content.description: This is a 13 foot boulder with one good problem on it.
